did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Land bounty certificates for French and Indian War service from the Virginia Land Office,, 1774-1780

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Land bounty certificates for French and Indian War service from the Virginia Land Office, 1774-1780. Accession LOI 77. State government records collection, The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Transferred in 1948 from the Secretary of the Commonwealth, Richmond, VA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Certificates, 1774-1780, showing that proof of military service during the colonial wars was presented to and accepted by the issuing authority, either a county court or Lord Dunmore, the royal governor. Dated 1774, 1779, and 1780, the certificates include the name of the soldier; his rank, unit, and length of service; the county in which his service was proved, which was not necessarily his county of residence; and, on the reverse, the number assigned the certificate and any assignments which may have been made on the certificate up to the time the warrant was issued.

Of note some of the certificates contain multiple names. The list is alphabetical and if the name was listed on someone else's certificate it references the name of the certificate in which the person was referenced as [See: Name].

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged alphabetically by last name.
